Module schach
Package schach.controller.interfaces

Class HumanVsComputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • schach.controller.interfaces.HumanVsComputer
  • public class HumanVsComputer
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the interaction between the human and the computer in Human vs Ai game

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private AiInterface aiInterface
      the ai interface that generates new moves by the ai
      private Board board
      the board the game is played on
      private PlayerInput playerInput
      the playerInput interface that handles all player input
      private boolean playerIsWhite
      boolean that defines if the play chose color white(true) or black(false)
      private boolean playersTurn
      boolean that defines whose turn is next

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HumanVsComputer()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private boolean askForWhite()
      I/O method that asks for the color the player wants
      private void computerMove()
      gets the move generated by the ai and process it so it can be forwarded to a board move call checks for promotion
      private void init()
      Constructor initializing the fields and setting up a board with the starting lineup
      private void playerMove()
      gets the move input by the playerInput interface, processes it so it can get forwarded to the board move call.
      void runningRoutine()
      Routine that handles the interaction between player and ai and asking for moves

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()
        Constructor initializing the fields and setting up a board with the starting lineup

      • runningRoutine

        public void runningRoutine()
        Routine that handles the interaction between player and ai and asking for moves

      • askForWhite

        private boolean askForWhite()
        I/O method that asks for the color the player wants
        Returns:
        true if input 'white', false if input 'black'

      • playerMove

        private void playerMove()
        gets the move input by the playerInput interface, processes it so it can get forwarded to the board move call. Checks for validation and if its a promotion, if invalid move: recursively calls it self

      • computerMove

        private void computerMove()
        gets the move generated by the ai and process it so it can be forwarded to a board move call checks for promotion
